reviewText: Only 3 stars for the 3 original movies I like Jackie Chan but nothing compared to the original I'm actually buying the original ones I own part 1 & 2 on blue ray wish 3 & 4 were on blue ray and the new one should have been called the kung fu kid

Came with 3 DVD's.

Disc one: Karate Kid (original)
Disc two: Karate Kid 2 and 3
Disc three: Karate Kid (remake)

Mine also came with UV codes for all four movies. Minus one star because it was three discs, not four discs, and the "Next Karate Kid" was not included. All for $5.00. An awesome deal!

Pros: Comes with 3 discs, Karate Kid Special Edition (Disc 1), Karate Kid II & III (Disc 2), the Karate Kid (Disc3). It's also Digital Ultraviolet discs. For it being for sale at $4.99 ($14.99 reg price) on Amazon, it's a great deal!

The only con I have is all 3 discs are placed in one disc holder (see picture).

All in all, it's worth buying and having in your movie collection!

This review is regarding this 4-pack sold here specifically and NOT a film review (which you can easily find on a more trusted venue with a simple google search).

Disc #2 is falsely labelled as CC (Closed Captions available for the deaf and hearing impaired).  I'm a huge fan of the movies since the 80's and wanted to show them to my deaf son.  Got through the first film with subtitles on no problem and he loved it so much he immediately requested we watch the sequels... so I put in disc#2 and found subtitles do not work on Karate Kid II or Karate Kid III.  Extremely disappointing since he has to view the rest of the movies without sound and guess at what is happening in the plot, or I have to now track down another more expensive version of these films so he can actually enjoy them.  I tried a replacement and that didn't work either, plus I read other reviews on here experiencing the same problem so it is obviously across the board.

Packaging lied.  If you are deaf or hard of hearing, the captions don't work on the 2nd and 3rd movie.  They are on the same disc. They say they have captions but I tried turning them on through the dvd (No option to do so). So i tried through the dvd player,  said no captions.  Tried through tv, also no captions.
They stack three dvds on top of each other. Not the most convenient case.
If you don't need captions,  then I'm sure you'll love it. I haven't checked out the fourth disc yet.

As unfair as it is, I'm giving this four stars because of a personal beef.  If you're going to produce a four movie box set of "Karate Kid" movies then it should be the four Pat Morita movies.  I can get the reboot from any $2 bin at Wal-Mart.  If you're an old school "Karate Kid" fan (which you must be if you're buying this set) then you're probably a Pat Morita fan and even though "The Next Karate Kid" didn't get the rave reviews of the first three it still belongs in the family and shouldn't be usurped by a reboot.

I have NO IDEA why ALL 4 movies -- legal copies -- are on sale right now for $3.99 when the individual movies normally cost more. Whatever -- this is deal!

The reason why I docked off a star is because the packaging is nothing pretty: bare minimum, simply discs stacked on top of one another, no pamphlets (but you do receive print instruction for downloading digital copies by Dec. 2017), 2 discs had no imagery (only text title) and specifically mine arrived with its exterior plastic sleeve warped as though it were exposed to a drizzle of boiling water.

Ultimately, I do recommend getting this (at its sale price) while it lasts if you just care about viewing very decent, legit copies of these movies.

I'm not going to say much about the movies themselves here. If you don't know the story line of the Karate Kid and have yet to experience the joys of "wax on, wax off" then you my friend are missing out on life and need to immediately purchase this collection.
 My 11 year old is a complete 80's movie fanatic. We had already owned a copy of the Karate Kid but as with most DVDs that reside in this house it had gotten scratched up and was "skippy" as my younger kids like to put it. He had added the collection to his Amazon wish list a while ago and was going through it and noticed the price drop. My husband figured at roughly about a buck a movie how could we loose. I was however sad because I have been slowly trying to convert all of our DVDs to digital copy to avoid the scratched DVD issue we have in our house. So I can say I was so pleasantly surprised to here my kids shouting with glee that there was indeed a digital copy code in the case with the movies! Daniel LaRusso can now go with us everywhere. No longer will long waits at the doctor's office be filled with sighs and cries of "how much longer", but will instead be filled with crane kicks and amazingly bad and at the same time inspiring songs sung by Joe Esposito. Now that my friends is worth the four bucks!

Other than that, great product.

This dvd collection comes with 4 movies to view on 3 disks:
1. The Karate Kid (original movie)
2. The Karate Kid II and III
3. The Karate Kid: Special Edition (with Jaden Smith)
It also comes with Digital copies to instantly stream or download, which the code doesn't expire until the end of 2017.

I am 100% happy with my purchase!! I paid $3.99 total and received Prime Shipping.  Other options available were to pay for the DVDs and then an additional ~$3.99 for shipping. As a kid, I loved Danielson and Mr. Miyagi...now I can watch these classic films whenever (and wherever, because of the digital copies) I want! Thank you!

Haven't played it yet if quality is no good I'll redo, but these four packs always have been fine.  This is a great deal and listen to this.  It comes with a Vudu Ultraviolet Card to upload all four movies to your account.  So it's like getting the dvd free if you look at what it costs to upload Vudu movies.  It's all four movies on three discs.  No front and back like they usually do.  First disc is original movie.  Second disc is two and three on one side so no flipping.  Disc 3 is new 2010 version with Will Smiths son " it's a good movie" whole new twist, with Jackie Chan as the trainer.  You got to get this at this price if you like Karate Kid.
